summary: Lalalune is actively developing a model provider abstraction for the project, focusing on enhancing character changes, runtime references, and documentation. They have successfully merged their branch into the main repository and are working towards making the builds functional while ensuring compatibility across various model providers. Additionally, they've addressed issues related to abstracting transcript providers and image descriptions/recognition for broader usability.

commits.message: abstraction with vercel ai seems to be working
Merge branch 'main' of https://github.com/elizaos/eliza into model-provider-abstraction
replaced completions with model provider abstraction and generate text
build builds, but model completions are not going to work for all providers

pull_requests.title: Model provider abstraction
pull_requests.body: Adds model provider abstraction, WIP not ready

reviews.author: sirkitree
reviews.body:
Whoa. Dat's a bigun... I'm not knowledgeable enough with this codebase yet to provide valid feedback in terms of saying this is good or not.

I'd prefer if you had an issue for this PR, referenced issues that are relevant to the change, and explained the changes and steps to test in your PR. Large PR out of the blue is how this feels currently... 

I definitely would like some testing steps.

but let's see here...

Overall you're trying to provide some model abstraction.

## Provide More Models
- anthropic
- google
- groq
- The abstraction in src/core/models.ts is interesting, looks good at the outset but not sure how to test.

## Pumpfun
- added some constants that are passed along for context

## Order book
- uncommented a lot of code here, which introduces some basic order book functionality

## Embeddings
- I'm not clear on what all this is doing, but I gather  it's somehow used in the core memory

## Error Handling Improvements
- Adds proper error handling for cases where no appropriate response pattern is found
- Implements a fallback mechanism to provide default responses when specific patterns aren't matched

## Response Formatting
- Enhances the formatting of bot responses to ensure consistency
- Modifies the way responses are structured and returned to the user

## Code Organization
- Refactors the response selection logic to be more maintainable
- Streamlines the pattern matching process for better efficiency

comments.author: lalalune
comments.body: @sirkitree please take a look. I think we need to consider secrets management, but I tested with OpenAI. I think you'll agree it is much better :)

comments.author: lalalune
comments.body: No, this is for dealing with the horrible API key management. It makes it so you just set a model provider in your character file and it uses that one. Replaces a lot of very fragile code.

opened.title: Add npx action
opened.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

The goal of this is to enable someone to run 'npx eliza' and it would start a default local running instance of eliza that they could interact with through chat, using all local models.

If the user passes a character file, like --characters=<eliza.json>, then it will load that character file. If the characterfile has secrets in it, it will load all of the secrets, as though they had cloned the repo and run npm run dev -- --characters=<eliza>.json

The result of this feature is that I can run `npx @elizaos/eliza` and trial locally, or point to a character file and run an agent (or agents)

comments.author: roninjin10
comments.body: Happy to add this. What is the entrypoint file that needs to run for this?

opened.title: Abstract transcript provider
opened.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

Right now the options for model provider for transcription are openai and local with whisper. The OpenAI is hardcoded to check for the existence of the API key, and then load that, otherwise use the local.

**Describe the solution you'd like**

Similar to the new model provider abstraction, we want to offer image recognition for whatever the current model is. For example, Claude, Vertex Claude, Cloud Llama, etc.

opened.title: Abstract image descriptions / recognition to use any model provider
opened.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

Right now the options for model provider for image recognition are openai and local with florence 2.  The OpenAI is hardcoded to check for the existence of the API key, and then load that, otherwise use the local.

**Describe the solution you'd like**

Similar to the new model provider abstraction, we want to offer image recognition for whatever the current model is. For example, Claude, Vertex Claude, Cloud Llama, etc.

summary: Sirkitree is currently addressing a TypeScript issue where the Promise.withResolvers function does not exist, as evidenced by their recent merge pull request #71 from eltociear/patch-1. They have also been active in bug fixing within their project, with one open issue and two code changes that balance out to zero net change in commits.

commits.message:
Merge pull request #71 from eltociear/patch-1

chore: fix typo

opened.title: TypeError: Promise.withResolvers is not a function
opened.body:
From an off comment in https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/47#issuecomment-2443482858 from https://github.com/adnanmirza1

**Describe the bug**

Hello @sirkitree, hope you'll be fine. Sorry for being off the topic but I need help setting up this project on my linux machine, I added env's, node v 20.13.1, runned npm i which was successful, and now after node --loader ts-node/esm src/index.ts
I'm seeing below error.
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/afcd9b0b-9469-46be-bd28-a534478be9da)

comments.author: sirkitree
comments.body: @adnanmirza1 can you please add step to reproduce this bug reliably?

comments.author: sirkitree
comments.body:
I'm now experiencing this.

This error occurs because Promise.withResolvers() is a relatively new feature that isn't available in Node.js v20.18.0. 

We have a few options to fix this:
1. Upgrade to Node.js v21.0.0 or later where Promise.withResolvers() is supported
1. Use an older version of pdfjs-dist that doesn't use this feature. You can modify your package.json
1. Create a polyfill for Promise.withResolvers(). You would need to add this before importing pdfjs-dist

I think we should go with option 1.

comments.author: sirkitree
comments.body: Tested this PR and it works - do you want to give it a shot @adnanmirza1 ?

comments.author: adnanmirza1
comments.body:
thanks @sirkitree, I just cloned it followed the steps from readme, installed the packages using npm i, (node version 20.13.1).
After this I started the project using command npm run start and got this Promise.withResolvers error. 
I did some search and added polyfill and the issue was solved using the guides from issue
https://github.com/wojtekmaj/react-pdf/issues/1811

then after some time I simply updated the node version to 22.10.0 using nvm and the issue was solved even without the polyfill.

opened.title: Execution gets stuck in a loop
opened.body:
My agent has been getting caught in an random loop where this is included in the terminal output:
```
parsedContent is null
parsedContent is null, retrying
```
The request body is the usual size and headers are as expected, I can't see what the issue is and what repro steps there are. I'm only running text interaction on Discord.

If I get more insight I'll update it here.

comments.author: lalalune
comments.body: Hmmm, hmu on discord (new.moon) and lets fix it.

comments.author: St4rgarden
comments.body: I have run into this a few times as well.
